conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with visible thickness, angled/isometric viewpoint, and ceiling/roof removed exposing interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and corner geometry; clear separation of floor plane and walls; clean cutaway with readable interior from elevated angle.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment-like arrangement is similar (central living/dining, perimeter bedrooms, clustered wet areas), but several key plan-specific spaces and room identities do not align: the top deck(s) and the upper-middle bedroom (BED-3 in 2D) are not faithfully represented, and one bedroom appears placed where the 2D plan shows foyer/HO/TOI/entry-related spaces. Wall/partition layout and opening locations look generic rather than matching the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (sofa set, dining, kitchen counters, toilets). However, because some rooms are not in the correct locations relative to the 2D plan, furniture-to-room assignment is only partially faithful.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with consistent materials and no obvious broken meshes; lighting and contrast are sufficient to interpret spaces.

detected_errors.description: Layout fidelity issues: room placement/shape does not match the 2D plan (notably the upper-middle bedroom vs. deck region and entry/utility-related zones).

Major room identity mismatch: a bedroom appears in an area that corresponds to non-bedroom spaces in the 2D plan, while at least one plan-defined bedroom/deck configuration is not faithfully reconstructed.
Doors/windows and openings appear simplified/generic and are not clearly on the same walls/positions as the 2D plan.

summary: A valid and clean 3D cutaway was produced, but the generated model only loosely matches the original 2D floor plan geometry, with notable room/location mismatches.
